property.name: userLevelDocumentation
property.configure: On each firing, output true if the input is present and true. Otherwise, output nothing. The type of the input and output ports is boolean. The width of the input is expected to match the width of the output. Note that the utility of this actor varies by domain. In PN, for example, the input is always present (by definition). In SDF, it is expected to be always present, but may not be. In DE, the actor is only triggered if one of the input channels has data. The actor is probably most useful in synchronous domains like SR and Giotto.

property.name: port:output
property.configure: The output port. By default, the type of this output is constrained to be at least that of the input.

property.name: port:input
property.configure: The input port. This base class imposes no type constraints except that the type of the input cannot be greater than the type of the output.
